description: Enterprise techniques used by APT39, ATT&CK group G0087 v1.0
name: APT39 (G0087)

techniques.comment: [APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) used [Remexi](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0375) to collect usernames from the system.
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has repacked a modified version of [Mimikatz](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0002) to thwart anti-virus detection.
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has sent spearphishing emails in an attempt to lure users to click on a malicious attachment or link.
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has installed ANTAK and ASPXSPY web shells.
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) used secure shell (SSH) to move laterally among their targets.
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used stolen credentials to compromise Outlook Web Access (OWA).
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) utilized custom scripts to perform internal reconnaissance.
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) used a custom port scanner known as BLUETORCH
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used Mimikatz, Ncrack, Windows Credential Editor and ProcDump to dump credentials.
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) used custom tools to create SOCK5 proxies between infected hosts.
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used WinRAR and 7-Zip to compress an archive stolen data.
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has used nbtscan to discover vulnerable systems.
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has been seen using RDP for lateral movement and persistence.
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) has maintained persistence using the startup folder.
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) leveraged spearphishing emails with malicious links to initially compromise victims.
[APT39](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0087) leveraged spearphishing emails with malicious attachments to initially compromise victims.
